metadata.title: CVE-2023-27534 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - low
metadata.description: A path traversal vulnerability exists in curl <8.0.0 SFTP implementationcauses the tilde (~) character to be wrongly replaced when used as a prefixin the first path element, in addition to its intended use as the firstelement to indicate a path relative to the user's home directory. Attackerscan exploit this flaw to bypass filtering or execute arbitrary code bycrafting a path like /~2/foo while accessing a server with a specific user.

criterions.comment: curl: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
